headline: Reunited
short descr: I grew up on the border between the United States and Mexico, near the boundary line that starts at the Pacific Ocean and weaves east toward the Gulf of Mexico. My parents, who are both from Tijuana, met in that city in the late 1970s while my father was home from California’s Central Valley, where he was a field worker. They decided to build a family across the border in San Diego, and that’s where I was born.

headline: North Korea Crisis: Dialogue And Diplomacy Over Fire And Fury
authors: William Lambers, ContributorAuthor, journalist,and historian. Partnered with UN World Food...
short descr: Co-authored with Brenna Gautam who is a member of the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty’s Organization’s Youth Group
image_caption(s): Children at Samchon Nursery School wave from a window. Children here receive soy, oil and cereal milk blend. The food is donated by the international community as North Korea struggles to produce food for its own people. headline: Over 67,000 Londoners Showed Up For A Halal Food Festival This Weekend
short descr: Organizer Zohra Khaku is on a mission to find the best halal food out there.
image_caption(s): "Some of the highlights include there being a space for families to spend time," Khaku said. "We had grandmas and great grandchildren and everything in between. It was wonderful to see families sat on the grass, each with food from a different vendor."

authors: Stateline, ContributorStateline provides daily reporting and analysis on trends in s...
short descr: Rural veterans are far older and far more likely to be disabled than other rural residents. New programs across the country
image_caption(s): Lynn Graham sits on his porch in Redwater, Texas, after returning from an appointment at the closest U.S. Department of Veteran Affairs medical center, which is 85 miles from his home. The VA is testing new programs to ensure that veterans in rural areas get health care.
